channel.title: Im joining the line of poeple asking for help with pick ing a computer :P
channel.description:
I want a new computer or laptop so can someone post the specs they think i needfor some gaming, and homework and the usual other stuff. and how much it costs?
thanks

item.title: Im joining the line of poeple asking for help with pick ing a computer :P
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Bobby:

450 mb of ram. ok. so what manufactureres don’t rip you off?

Well, most of the high street brands (Dell, HP, Alienware) generally rip you off for what you get. You can find some good online stores that sell computers at a reasonable price. Never, ever, ever buy from PC World or stores similar.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883103095 - That’s a nice one, not bad price either.

Don’t go with Dell. Generally, they rip you off quite badly. They have bad customer service and physically lie to you…

For RAM, go to:
My Computer > View System Details (Located: First item on the side bar)

item.title: Im joining the line of poeple asking for help with pick ing a computer :P
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

For Runescape gaming? You’ll need 512mb of RAM, and that’s being generous. If you intend to use the computer solely for Runescape, then don’t go out spending big bucks. Just pay a standard laptop. 512 mb RAM, 128mb vid card, 40GB HD. Shouldn’t cost more than $250?

Read full topic

item.source: Im joining the line of poeple asking for help with pick ing a computer :P

item.title: Im joining the line of poeple asking for help with pick ing a computer :P
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Expect to pay more for a Desktop. Bobby, what do you intend to do on this PC? Gaming? School work? A mixture?

Either way I recommend custom building. It works out to be about $400 cheaper than buying from a high street retailer. I suggest:
GeForce6100SM-M Mobo (You can take out the vid card that comes inbuilt with it. It’s only 256mb)
1GB of RAM minimum, however you can find 2GB of RAM pretty cheap now. Also, try and find 2x 1GB RAM sticks, instead of 4x 512mb ram sticks.
80+GB HD (I found a 300GB one really cheap, I’ll find the link for you.)

If you are going to get a graphics card, make sure you make your psu something like 500W as 300W or lower often wont handle a vid card upgrade.

Read full topic
item.source: Im joining the line of poeple asking for help with pick ing a computer :P

item.title: Im joining the line of poeple asking for help with pick ing a computer :P
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Here’s a decent one for 1200$:

http://www.dell.com/content/products/productdetails.aspx/xpsdt_410?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs

And then for 1000$, slightly worse but still an ok gaming platform:

http://www.dell.com/content/products/productdetails.aspx/xpsdt_210?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs

And then if you are made of money and just happen to have 5000$ + laying around:

http://www.dell.com/content/products/productdetails.aspx/xpsdt_720h2c?c=us&cs=19&l=en&s=dhs

Read full topic
